intro: [WRONG START] Fernandezia micrangi, commonly known as the narrow-angled fernandezia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains in South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheat and other related plants. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Fernandezia micrangi typically thrives in moist, well-drained soils in high-altitude environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies in alpine regions.
